title: How to Set a Wallpaper on Google Photos on iPhone or iPad

steps.title: You can use any image from Google Photos as your iPhone or iPad's wallpaper.
steps.content: You can use any image from Google Photos as your iPhone or iPad's wallpaper. Here's how to download your favorite photo: Open the Google Photos app. Tap the photo you want to use to open it. Swipe up on the photo to display its info. Tap Download . This saves the photo to your iPhone or iPad's Photos app.

steps.title: Tap the Photos app that came with your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Tap the Photos app that came with your iPhone or iPad. It's the multicolored flower icon on the home screen or in your app library.

steps.title: Tap the photo in your camera roll to open it.
steps.content: Tap the photo in your camera roll to open it. If you don't see it automatically, tap the Albums tab at the bottom and then tap All Photos and it should be at the very bottom.

steps.title: Tap square with an up-arrow .
steps.content: Tap square with an up-arrow . You'll see it at the bottom-left corner of the photo.

steps.title: Swipe up a little on the menu, then tap Use as Wallpaper.
steps.content: Swipe up a little on the menu, then tap Use as Wallpaper . Now you can customize the image before making your change.

steps.title: Position the image how you'd like it to appear on your screen.
steps.content: Position the image how you'd like it to appear on your screen. Pinch with two fingers on the image to zoom in or out, and/or drag the image around to position it.

steps.title: Tap Set to use the current view as your wallpaper.
steps.content: Tap Set to use the current view as your wallpaper. On the resulting menu, you can choose whether to use the wallpaper on your Home screen, for your Lock screen, or set both. Once you make a selection, your wallpaper will be set.
